titles.title: Class Size Demonstration Act of 1987
A bill to provide financial assistance to local educational agencies to demonstrate the advantages of implementing plans to reduce class size.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.
Committee on Labor and Human Resources requested executive comment from OMB, Education Department.
Referred to Subcommittee on Education, Arts, Humanities.

bill.summary: 12/2/1987--Introduced. Class Size Demonstration Act of 1987 - Authorizes appropriations for FY 1989 and thereafter to carry out this Act. Directs the Secretary of Education to make demonstration grants to local educational agencies having elementary and secondary schools with large classes in order to demonstrate the advantages of reducing the size of classes. Sets forth grant selection criteria, application requirements, and audit requirements. Sets forth provisions for the Federal share of program payments.
